\begin{abstract}
We investigate the possibility that gauge fields 
%electromagnetic fluctuations 1
are amplified in an expanding universe by parametric resonance, during the
oscillatory regime of a scalar field to which they are coupled. 
We investigate the coupling of gauge fields to a charged scalar field and
to an axion.
For both couplings, gauge fields fluctuations undergo 
exponential instabilities. We discuss how the presence of other charges 
or currents may counteract
the resonance, but we argue that in some cases the resonance will
persist and that hence this mechanism could have some
relevance for the problem of large scale primordial
magnetic fields.
\end{abstract}
